subject: Re: [junit] Fresher's Question - Testing API's
msgSnippet: ... You can compare fragments of XML using assertXMLEqual(). Also, you can implement the DifferenceListener interface to ignore any kind of difference you want
messageBody:
Arun J wrote:

> May not be relevant to this thread but to your posting.
>
> Can I do partial comparison using XMLUnit? What I mean is check
> <firstname> and <lastname> and ignore/skip the rest type of
> comparison.

You can compare fragments of XML using assertXMLEqual().

Also, you can implement the DifferenceListener interface to ignore any
kind of difference you want for a given test. I have an example of this
in _JUnit Recipes_, chapter 9.

I hope this helps.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
